items.title: CVE-2025-62706 | Authlib up to 1.6.4 Decompression decompress resource consumption (GHSA-g7f3-828f-7h7m)
items.author: vuldb.com
items.content: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in Authlib up to 1.6.4. Affected by this issue is the function decompress of the component Decompression Handler. The manipulation results in resource consumption. This vulnerability is identified as CVE-2025-62706. The attack can be executed remotely. There is not any exploit available. Upgrading the affected component is advised.

items.title: CVE-2025-62708 | py-pdf pypdf up to 6.1.2 LZWDecode Filter data amplification (GHSA-jfx9-29x2-rv3j)
items.author: vuldb.com
items.content: A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in py-pdf pypdf up to 6.1.2. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the component LZWDecode Filter. The manipulation leads to highly compressed data. This vulnerability is referenced as CVE-2025-62708. Remote exploitation of the attack is possible. No exploit is available. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component.

items.title: CVE-2025-62707 | py-pdf pypdf up to 6.1.2 DCTDecode Filter iteration (GHSA-vr63-x8vc-m265)
items.author: vuldb.com
items.content: A vulnerability described as problematic has been identified in py-pdf pypdf up to 6.1.2. Affected is an unknown function of the component DCTDecode Filter. Executing manipulation can lead to excessive iteration. The identification of this vulnerability is CVE-2025-62707. The attack may be launched remotely. There is no exploit available. Upgrading the affected component is recommended.
